claim(address[],address[],uint256[],byte.details: Anyone may call this function for anyone else, funds go to destination regardless, it's just a question of who provides the proof and pays the gas: `msg.sender` is not used in this function

params.amounts: Amount of tokens that will be sent to the corresponding users
params.proofs: Array of hashes bridging from leaf (hash of user | token | amount) to Merkle root

claim(address[],address[],uint256[],byte.notice: Claims rewards for a given set of users

claimed(address,address).notice: Mapping user -> token -> amount to track claimed amounts

tree().notice: Tree of claimable tokens through this contract

trusted(address).notice: Trusted EOAs to update the merkle root

userdoc.notice: Allows the DAO to distribute rewards through Merkle Roots
